39 void do_exit(int error)
40 {
47  if (h)
48  {
49  print_diag("pcan_topics");
50  CAN_Close(h);
51 
52  }
53  printf("pcan_topics: finished (%d).\n\n", error);
54  exit(error);
55 }

57 
58 // the opposite: lookup for device string out of HW_.. constant
59 char *getNameOfInterface(int nType)
60 {
67  switch (nType)
68  {
69  case HW_PCI: return "pci";
70  case HW_ISA_SJA: return "isa";
71  case HW_DONGLE_SJA: return "sp";
72  case HW_DONGLE_SJA_EPP: return "epp";
73  case HW_USB: return "usb";
74  case HW_USB_PRO: return "usbpro";
75  case HW_PCCARD: return "pccard";
76 
77  default: return "unknown";
78  }
79 }
80 
81 // print out device and channel diagnostics
82 void print_diag(const char *prgName)
83 {
90  int err;
91  TPDIAG diag;
92 
93  err = LINUX_CAN_Statistics(h, &diag);
94  if (err)
95  printf("%s: can't read diagnostics, error %d!\n", prgName, err);
96  else
97  {
98  printf("%s: type = %s\n", prgName, getNameOfInterface(diag.wType));
99  if ((diag.wType == HW_USB) || (diag.wType == HW_USB_PRO))
100  {
101  printf(" Serial Number = 0x%08x\n", diag.dwBase);
102  printf(" Device Number = %d\n", diag.wIrqLevel);
103  }
104  else
105  {
106  printf(" io = 0x%08x\n", diag.dwBase);
107  printf(" irq = %d\n", diag.wIrqLevel);
108  }
109  printf(" count of reads = %d\n", diag.dwReadCounter);
110  printf(" count of writes = %d\n", diag.dwWriteCounter);
111  printf(" count of errors = %d\n", diag.dwErrorCounter);
112  printf(" count of irqs = %d\n", diag.dwIRQcounter);
113  printf(" last CAN status = 0x%04x\n", diag.wErrorFlag);
114  printf(" last error = %d\n", diag.nLastError);
115  printf(" open paths = %d\n", diag.nOpenPaths);
116  printf(" driver version = %s\n", diag.szVersionString);
117  }
118 }
